column4: I am trying to install ubuntu for the first time ever, first linux for that matter, and i am having problems.  Can someone walk me through the inital set up?
it's best to just ask about whatever issue you're having.    However,
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/  At the beginning there there's three/four steps,  (gettiung, burning, integrity check, then the installatin guide)
that'll be more informative (and less forgetful) than anyone here can be.  If you still have questions, feel free to ask
10gb? wow.  You won't need more than a 512MB boot.  Ever.  And even that might be overkill
alright, so, let's reinstall, shall we?  See if we can't figure out your partitioning error, at that.
do you have the alternate or the desktop CD?
yeah.  which ISO did you download and burn?
right. So, desktop.  Ok.  (Alternate isn't server, by the way)
alternate CD is a text based install (instead of the GUI one), that is usually more stable and robust.
Alternate CD isnt on the main download page, for some random reason.
so, start the install, and when you get to partitioning, let me know
alright.  So, you want /boot on a separate partition, anything else?  /home? or anything?
